section.description: The Button Genie generates all the Xdialog code for a button. The Button Genie provides:

case.description: a view of the Xdialog code as it is composed
an interactive WYSIWYG view of the finished button
a list of basic button styles

section.description: In addition, there are menus to define:

case.description: every aspect of the button's label and or image, including font, color, style, and positioning
every aspect of the button's style, including fill colors, borders, and flyover effects
an associated event for the button
an enabling expression for the button

section.description: When working on a Xbasic script in the Code Editor, right click and select Genies ... > Xdialog > Button Genie ....

section.title: Example
section.description: The Button Genie dialog box defines all the attributes of an Xdialog button. The results are displayed in two ways:

case.description: a preview to the right of the genie, and in
the Xdialog Code window at the bottom of the genie

section.description: Finally, clicking the Insert Code in Script Editor button inserts the Xdialog code into your script.
